_comment: This is an example config file.
_comment2: All config files MUST be named '_config.json'.

default-settings/source-folder/._comment: Keys ending with slash or backslash indicate folders. All image files sub-folders in the folder inherit settings defined here.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment2: Configuration for sub-folders and individual files will override these settings.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_ignore: If ignore is true, every image in this folder is ignored, unless a config file in a subfolder overrides it.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_override: Relative paths in override determine where images in the config file's directory get saved in the game's graphics folder.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_override2: If there are paths in override, both include and exclude must not exist or must be empty.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_override3: All paths listed here must be defined in settings.json.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_include: Relative paths in include get added to the paths given in the config files of parent directories.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_include2: A path cannot exist in both include and exclude.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_include3: All paths listed here must be defined in settings.json.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_exclude: Relative paths in exclude get removed from the paths given in the config files of parent directories.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_exclude2: All paths listed here must be defined in settings.json.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_crop_anchor: When cropping an image, this is the centre-point for the cropping, determined as a double between 0.0 and 1.0
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_crop_anchor2: The value 0.0 means that pixels from the bottom or right of the image are cropped, while top or left of the image is preserved.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_crop_anchor3: The value 1.0 means that pixels from the top or left of the image are cropped, while bottom or right of the image is preserved.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_crop_anchor4: The value 0.5 means that pixels from the top/left and bottom/right are cropped as equally as possible.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_crop_anchor5: In most cases you would want to set this individually for each image that you do not want to be centred when cropped.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_folder: In settings.json, {folder} is a placeholder value which is normally replaced by the name of the folder where the source image is.
default-settings/source-folder/._comment_folder2: Using this, you can override this default behaviour and set the folder name manually.

default-settings/source-file._comment: Keys not ending with slash or backslash indicate files. Settings defined here only affect that particular file.
default-settings/source-file._comment2: Note that file keys do not have file extensions.
default-settings/source-file._comment3: These settings work the same way as in the folder configuration.
default-settings/source-file._comment4: The settings below only work in file configurations.
default-settings/source-file._comment_save_as: Normally the image will be saved with the same name as the source image. This setting can be used to override that behaviour. Do not include the extension.
default-settings/source-file._comment_save_as2: Useful if you want to have a different source image for a particular logo size, for example.
default-settings/source-file._comment_duplicates: If you want to use the same source logo for multiple teams, list them all here. Do not include the extension.

.._comment: Key with only a dot ('.') indicates that these settings apply to the same folder where the config file is, and its sub-folders.
